title: [$250] Change empty states

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Previously we've had this skeleton + card for empty states: This worked well for a while, but we'd now like to replace them with something simpler and more obvious to encourage users to get started quicker. --- This is what we have in mind: Hopefully this requires tweaking the empty state component we already have as it's mostly: - Remove skeleton in the background - Remove card container - Remove background container with solid color - Change button from full-width to auto and from large to regular The places I can think of empty states: - Reports page and all the items in the left hand navigation - Workspace tab - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Categories - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Tags - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Members (or I guess this is never empty so maybe it doesn't have one) - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Distance rates - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Per diem - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Taxes - Account -> Expense rules - Any others? cc @Expensify/design @JmillsExpensify

title: ESLint warning count (400) exceeds max-warnings limit (399), blocking all PRs

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem

The ESLint warning count in the main branch has reached **400 warnings**, which exceeds the configured `--max-warnings=399` limit. This causes the "ESLint check" CI job to fail for **all PRs**, regardless of whether they introduce new warnings.

### Evidence

From CI logs:
```
✖ 400 problems (0 errors, 400 warnings)
ESLint found too many warnings (maximum: 399).
```

### Current Warnings

The 400 warnings include pre-existing issues such as:
- `Onyx.connect()` deprecation warnings in `src/libs/Middleware/Pagination.ts`, `src/libs/LocalePhoneNumber.ts`, `src/libs/CurrencyUtils.ts`
- React hook dependency warnings in:
  - `src/hooks/useTransactionViolationOfWorkspace.tsx` (useMemo missing dependency)
  - `src/hooks/useDeleteTransactions.ts` (useCallback missing 'betas' dependency)
  - `src/components/TabSelector/TabSelectorBase.tsx` (function makes dependencies change on every render)
  - `src/components/MoneyRequestReportView/MoneyRequestReportTransactionList.tsx` (useMemo missing dependency)

### Impact

- All new PRs fail the ESLint check
- The "Changed files ESLint check" passes (verifying new code is clean), but the full "ESLint check" fails
- This blocks PR merges and creates confusion for contributors

## Proposed Solution

Fix at least one of the existing warnings to bring the count back under 399. The warnings listed above are good candidates:

1. **Quick fix**: Add missing dependencies to React hooks
2. **Longer-term**: Address the `Onyx.connect()` deprecation warnings by migrating to `useOnyx()` hook

## Workaround (Not Recommended)

Increasing `--max-warnings` in `.github/workflows/lint.yml` would be a temporary workaround, but this would hide the underlying technical debt.

---

**Platforms:** All
**Version:** N/A (CI infrastructure)
**Reproducible in staging?:** N/A
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A

cc @neil-marcellini for proposal review

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @dubielzyk-expensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Product](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1770160800719189?thread_ts=1770036345.929619&cid=C03U7DCU4) ## Action Performed: ## Why Is This Feature Needed? Some expenses require multiple receipts (e.g., split receipts, hotel folios, tips, add-ons, or corrections). Currently in New Expensify, users cannot easily attach more than one receipt to a single expense, forcing workarounds or incomplete documentation. ## Expected Result: Users can attach multiple receipts to one expense ## Actual Result: No option now to add a second receipt ## Proposed UX: Add a “+” button on or near the existing receipt preview Clicking the “+” opens the file picker, equivalent to selecting Add attachment Each additional receipt is added as an attachment to the same expense All attached receipts are viewable from the expense ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

**Issue reported by:** @muttmuure 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1769427938588559)

## Action Performed:

1. In New Expensify, navigate to Reports 
2. Click on filters 
3. Create and save the first Saved Search (e.g., "Reconciliation Credit Card")
4. Create a second Saved Search with different filters/criteria
5. Save the second search

## Expected Result:
Both Saved Searches should coexist in the user's Saved Searches list, allowing multiple custom searches to be saved and managed independently.
## Actual Result:
Saving the second Saved Search completely wipes out/replaces the first Saved Search. The original "Reconciliation Credit Card" search disappears and is no longer accessible.
## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome

- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770076002234039)

## Action Performed:

1. Admin attempts to update an existing approval workflow to A → B → C
2. Admin tries to remove approver A from the original workflow
3. Admin saves the updated workflow

## Expected Result:
Admin should be able to edit and save the approval workflow
Removed approvers (e.g., A) should no longer appear in the workflow
Deleted workflows should be fully removed
## Actual Result:
Saving the workflow triggers a UI loop
Approver A cannot be removed from the original workflow
Even after deleting the original approval workflow, it remains active
## Workaround:
Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **For all Exploratory issues, start the title of the issue with `[Exploratory]`** (and, do **not** add the `External` label. **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): ## Action Performed: 1. Have multiple expenses, in the current year and also in 2025 before and after December 1st, 2025 2. Go to Reports and tap on Expenses 3. Group by Year 4. Add a filter for date >= December 1st, 2025 5. Trigger the search 6. Click on the 2025 group to expand ## Expected Result: It should fetch only the expenses from 2025 that are after December 1st ## Actual Result: It returns all expenses from 2025, and the count from the group header is wrong ## Workaround: Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround? ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a13cfe26-bf02-4adc-85e7-69c772d671b5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-48 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No, new feature **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @quinthar **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify_convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1770144126683779) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Go to Home page 3. Click to Reports page ## Expected Result: The same icons for Submit should used for Home page and Reports page ## Actual Result: Different icons for Submit between Home and Reports pages ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (The steps described could not be executed as missing details)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @Chryzta
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [expensify_bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770100360279579)

## Action Performed:
Account with a lot of reports/expenses

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 
2. Go to Reports page > open some of report with different expenses

## Expected Result:
User should check  Audit history without any issue

## Actual Result:
Audit history is greyed out in preview field

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

For the details check please [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770100360279579)
